channel.title: International News,More on NewsStreet | News portal
channel.description: Recent content in International News,More on NewsStreet | News portal

item.title: No relief for Pakistan as Foreign Direct Investment (FDI) continues to slump
item.description: No relief for Pakistan as Foreign Direct Investment (FDI) continues to slump The outflows for the months stood at USD 63 million, rising by 130 per cent year-on-year, and leaving net FDI of less than USD 84, down by 66 per cent year-on-year

item.title: 'Our Obama moment': United Kingdom (UK) Hindu temple leader Sanjay Chandarana on Rishi Sunak becoming PM
item.description: ‘Our Obama moment’: United Kingdom (UK) Hindu temple leader Sanjay Chandarana on Rishi Sunak becoming PM “It’s the Obama moment, where a non-white person becomes PM for the first time, also a person from India and Hindu which is another dimension and pride,” says Chandarana

item.title: 2 missing Indians killed in East African country Kenya
item.description: 2 missing Indians killed in East African country Kenya India has described as “very disturbing” the events surrounding the abduction of its nationals in Kenya and the subsequent lack of information in the case.

item.title: Cyclone Sitrang kills 15 people in Bangladesh coasts
item.description: Cyclone Sitrang kills 15 people in Bangladesh coasts With high winds and heavy rains, the cyclone erased houses, crops and infrastructure in a vast swath of the country while most of the casualties were caused by falling trees

item.title: Italian PM Giorgia Meloni thanks Tibetan spiritual leader Dalai Lama
item.description: Italian PM Giorgia Meloni thanks Tibetan spiritual leader Dalai Lama Italian PM Giorgia Meloni thanked Tibetan spiritual leader the Dalai Lama for the message of affection by him on her appointment.

item.title: India will always stand with the Global South, says External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar
item.description: India will always stand with the Global South, says External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar S Jaishankar articulated both infringements of India’s core interests as well as issues of pressing global concern including the long impending UN reforms.

item.title: Pakistan convinces Saudi Arabia to set up $12 bn refinery, petrochemical complex
item.description: Pakistan convinces Saudi Arabia to set up $12 bn refinery, petrochemical complex The Pakistani side, according to the report, made huge efforts to persuade the kingdom to honour the MoUs and invest in the South Asian nation.
